intro: Lissanthe parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved lissanthe, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of delicate, white or pale purple flowers. It is often found in forest understories and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is not commonly cultivated outside its native range.
